name: Path N Perihilar Bile Ducts
title: Pathologic N
notes:
**Note 1:** Histological examination of a regional lymphadenectomy specimen will ordinarily include 15 or more lymph nodes. If the regional lymph nodes are negative, but the number ordinarily examined is not met, classify as pN0. (1)

**Note 2:**  Code only regional nodes and nodes, NOS, in this field. Distant nodes are coded in distant metastasis.

**Note 3:** Periaortic, pericaval, superior mesenteric artery, and celiac artery lymph nodes are coded to N2.
footnotes:
(1) International Union Against Cancer (UICC) *TNM Classification of Malignant Tumors,* 7th ed., Sobin, LH, Gospodarowicz, M, Wittekind, CH, eds. New York: Wiley, 2009, pg., 124

*N2 is not defined by UICC in the 7th edition. Approval has been provided by UICC to use âMetastasis to periaortic, pericaval, superior mesenteric artery, and/or celiac artery lymph nodesâ as N2.
rows: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

Surgical resection of primary and pathologic assessment of regional nodes are done but involvement of regional nodes not stated
Surgical resection of primary and pathologic assessment of regional nodes are done but involvement of regional nodes not documented in patient record
Regional lymph node metastasis including: nodes along the cystic duct common bile duct, common hepatic artery and portal vein

Regional lymph nodes:
    Cystic duct (node of the neck of the gallbladder) (Calot's node)
    Hepatic
    Hepatic artery
    Hilar (in the hepatoduodenal ligament)
    Node of the foramen of Winslow (omental) (epiploic)
    Pancreaticoduodenal
    Pericholedochal (node around common bile duct)
    Periduodenal
    Peripancreatic (near head of pancreas only)
    Periportal
    Porta hepatis (portal) (hilar) (in hilus of liver)
    Portal vein
    
Regional lymph node(s), NOS
Lymph nodes, NOS

Stated as N1

Metastasis to periaortic, pericaval, superior mesenteric artery, and/or celiac artery lymph nodes

Stated as N2
Clinically no nodes positive and no pathologic evaluation of nodes
In situ case as defined by TNM and there is a resection of the primary but the nodes are not evaluated pathologically
Pathologic N is not defined for the specific site/histology

No pathologic evaluation of regional lymph nodes and case is not in situ
Regional lymph node(s) cannot be assessed pathologically
No resection of a known primary (not T0)
No surgical resection of primary tumor and no positive biopsy of the highest N 
Unknown if any pathologic assessment performed
